hope you have a good time crocheting oscar supplies ● yarn of the same weight 4 worsted weight ● buff red heart around 70 g ● black i love this yarn color 30 ● white i love this yarn color 10 ● medium blue i love this yarn color 120 ● dark gray i love this yarn color 08 ● 5 5 mm i-9 crochet hook ● yarn needle ● scissors ● stitch markers optional ● sewing pins optional abbreviations us crochet terms magic_ring magic_ring chain-space chain space single_crochet single_crochet blo back loop only increase 2 single_crochet in the same st fo fasten_off half_double_crochet half_double_crochet skip skip half_double_crochet increase 2 half_double_crochet in the same st … total number of double_crochet double_crochet stitches st stitch es round round slip_stitch slip_stitch space space chain chain ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved notes ● when doing the half_double_crochet stitch throughout the entire pattern i picked up all three loops instead of the normal two picture a ● to attach the eyes ears and nose it may be easier for you to pin them to the cover to sew them on ● when attaching the back panel i found it easier to use stitch markers picture a to keep them aligned i also placed stitch markers in the corners skipping over the chain spaces to make it easier to make sure we skip them picture b ● to make the eyes i used an invisible fasten_off after each round it makes a cleaner look in my opinion i started each new round in the invisible fasten_off and the stitch i covered when doing the invisible fasten_off ● to attach the bushy eyebrows you picture b can either tie them to the stitches at the top of the eye or behind it using the tail you used to sew on the eye picture c ● to add the hair on the sides of the cover and in the ears i triple tied them to each half_double_crochet you can double knot if you want i just felt better with a triple knot picture c ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved front
